metadata.Title: CVE-2018-18839 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** An issue was discovered in Netdata 1.10.0. Full Path Disclosure (FPD) exists via api/v1/alarms. NOTE: the vendor says "is intentional."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18839` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

netdata - 1.19.0-3ubuntu1
netdata-apache2 - 1.19.0-3ubuntu1
netdata-core - 1.19.0-3ubuntu1
netdata-plugins-bash - 1.19.0-3ubuntu1
netdata-plugins-nodejs - 1.19.0-3ubuntu1
netdata-plugins-python - 1.19.0-3ubuntu1
netdata-web - 1.19.0-3ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netdata package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.19.0-3ubuntu1').
